EgiGeoZone is an Android Geofencing app, which uses several sensors on your phone or tablet to detect your location and then to trigger different actions when entering or leaving predefined zones that you can configure. It can trigger many actions directly, or simply display a notification on screen. In other words, the app works in a similar way to apps like Tasker, which allows certain events to initiate an action on your smartphone or even a remote server.

THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS \"AS IS\" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.\n\nA few of the icons are made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
The EgiGeoZone app does not collect any personal data from the users or do pass them to third parties. Also, the app does not generate any statistics
Description of the required Android permissions
This authorization allows the app to determine, among other things, the telephone number and device ID.
Used to determine the device ID. This is then sent to FHEM or other used servers to identify the user there.
Allows the app to send SMS messages. Charges may apply.
Allows the app to get your location.
Determining the location and the entry / exit of a Geozone (basic functionality of the app)
Allows the app to read and write to the SD card.
Read the certificates. Read and write the export / import file. Write, read and delete various log files.
Export and import the configuration to e.g. Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, and more.
Used to determine the location and used to start and stop Wifi.
Various data are needed to display the map, search in the map, GCM, and so on.
For using Google services, such as Geofence service, GCM, and Google Maps.
To check if Internet is available again. Thus one can repeat buffered server requests.
When you start (boot), the zones are passed to the Google Geofence service, since they are not remembered.
Starting and Stopping Wifi in "More Actions".
Start and stop vibration at "More Actions".
The device is only briefly awakened, so that actions can be started in the background.
In the subject and body of mails, in body of the SMS and in the server URL you can use variables, which will be replaced on runtime.

When you start the \"beacon scan \", the scans after BLE devices (Bluetooth Low Energy) is started. These devices are also called beacons. By starting BeaconZones can be created. This BeaconZones can be assigned to actions defined in the profiles, which are called when entering or leaving the BeaconZone. In principle, as the GeoZones.
Sorry, this device does not support Bluetooth LE.
Scan for Bluetooth devices not enabled. Go to Settings and start Beacon Scan.
Scan for Bluetooth devices not enabled
Click here to take this position
Here you can handle your profiles, which you can assign to your zones.
Here you can set several profiles, which you can assign to your zones. Tap \'+ \' for new profile.
Can not delete! Profile in use.
Copied API client key to clipboard
No API-Key present! Register first to Google GCM. See manual for details.
Interval in minutes to log location
Weekdays on which the event shall do his work
Attention! Disabling Wifi can cause disabilities in the recognition of geographic zones!
You can find the EgiGeoZone manual here:\n http://www.egigeozone.de/manual/default_en.html
Location accuracy: Consider only locations below the specified meters. \nOnly required for special cases. At the beginning, leave the value to 0. If not, it can happen, that no actions are executed!

From Android 6 for the functionality of the geographic zones the location permission is a prerequisite. Therefore, you should allow this permission in the next dialog and then optionally perform the action again.

From Android 6 for the functionality of the geographic zones the location permission is a prerequisite. You have declined this. Therefore, you will be asked again to accept this authorization. Then perform the action again.

This app writes a log file. Likewise, you can export the configuration and re-import it. From Android 6 for writing files a unique authorization is required. Therefore, you should allow this permission in the next dialog and then optionally perform the action again.

This app writes a log file. Likewise, you can export the configuration and re-import it. From Android 6 for writing files a unique authorization is required. You have declined this. Therefore, you will be asked again to accept this authorization. Then perform the action again.
To use GCM push messages, from Android 6 you must activate the access to the accounts (contacts). Therefore, you should allow this permission in the next dialog.
To use GCM push messages, from Android 6 you must activate the access to the accounts (contacts). You have rejected these and will therefore not be able to use GCM push messages.
From Android 6 to send a SMS (short messages) the SMS permission is a prerequisite. Therefore, you should allow this permission in the next dialog.
From Android 6 to send a SMS (short messages) the SMS permission is a prerequisite. You have rejected these and will therefore not be able to send SMS.
Enable App base permissions: Read phone state, Location and Write permissions

The server profiles make use of the device ID, to send it to the specified server. To do this, from Android 6 the read-phone-state permission is required. Therefore, you should allow this permission in the next dialog.

The server profiles make use of the device ID, to send it to the specified server. To do this, from Android 6 the read-phone-state permission is required. You have declined this. Therefore, you will be asked again to accept this authorization.

From Android 6 you have to enable the following permissions, so the app can run correctly. 

 Write permission (Storage): This app writes a log file. Likewise, you can export the configuration and re-import it.

 Location permission (Location): This is needed for the main functionality of the app.

 Read device id permission (Telephone): The server profiles makes use of the device ID, to send it to the specified server. 

 You have rejected these permissions. You may enable App the permissions now or later in the device settings (Settings ➝ Apps ➝ EgiGeoZone ➝ Permissions).

From Android 6 you have to enable the following permissions, so the app can run correct. 

 Write permission (Storage): This app writes a log file. Likewise, you can export the configuration and re-import it.

 Location permission (Location): This is needed for the main functionality of the app.

 Read device id permission (Telephone): The server profiles makes use of the device ID, to send it to the specified server.

Attention: This dialog comes only once!\n\n In the following Battery settings dialog, tap on the menu \u22ee and add the EgiGeoZone app to the Battery optimisation whitelist (not optimised). Otherwise it can be, that the app will not work properly.
To allow the app to mute the device (sound off or vibrate), you have to set \"Do not disturb\" permission in the following dialog.
You have set a tracking URL in the server profile. Please check your location tracking settings!

After save, the app will be restarted!!
